pullrequest.title: removed unecessary use_parent_model_frame elements from the double pendulum

content.raw:
It's true, these tags can be removed. 

I might have misunderstood what you meant on the description, but just a clarification, this is not because the joints are not rotated relative to their parent links.

When we `use_parent_model_frame`, the joint axis is oriented according to the **model**, when the tag is not there, it is oriented according to the **child link**.

On this model, the link rotations with respect to the model preserve the X axis, so these end up being the same. Note how the joint frames (the small ones) don't have the same Y and Z as the model frame (the big one), but the X axis is still in the same direction:

![doublepend1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/3347569345-doublepend1.png)

Let's see what happens when the joint axes are on the Y axis, one using the model frame while the other uses the child link frame:

~~~
    <!-- pin joint for upper link, at origin of upper link -->
    <joint name="upper_joint" type="revolute">
      <parent>base</parent>
      <child>upper_link</child>
      <axis>
        <xyz>0 1.0 0</xyz>
        <use_parent_model_frame>true</use_parent_model_frame>
      </axis>
    </joint>
    <!-- pin joint for lower link, at origin of child link -->
    <joint name="lower_joint" type="revolute">
      <parent>upper_link</parent>
      <child>lower_link</child>
      <axis>
        <xyz>0 1.0 0</xyz>
      </axis>
    </joint>
  </model>
~~~

![dbpend2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/352114154-dbpend2.png)
